table.docs: Used to store generic typed properties that can be attached to any asset.
table.name: AssetProperty

column.docs: This delivery should not be started untll this date. This dictates if a delivery is delayed in the delivery queue.
column.name: delayUntil

table.docs: This class provides a dynamic host list based on current host properties(user, memory, mhz, etc).
table.name: DynamicHostGroup

column.docs: Total System Memory in Megabytes.
column.name: memory

column.docs: Timestamp of last time puppet ran on this host
column.name: puppetPulse

column.docs: Added to indicate windows service pack version. Can be used for any OS if needed.
column.name: servicePackVersion

column.docs: Added to indicate windows build number. Can be used for any OS if needed.
column.name: buildNumber

column.docs: Size of the partition that assburner's spool directory resides on. In Megabytes.
column.name: spoolPartitionSize

column.docs: In Megabytes.
column.name: videoMemory

column.docs: Stores the amount of time the host has been slaved over the last 7 days. Continually updated.
column.name: slaveTimeLastWeek

column.docs: Amount of free space on the partition that assburners spool resides on. In Megabytes.
column.name: spoolPartitionSizeFree

table.docs:
@brief Job is the base table that represents an Assburner Job.
This table stores the type of job, the state and progress of the job, who submitted the job, who to notify regarding changes in the job, etc.
table.name: Job

column.docs:
@brief Represents all the users to notify regarding job errors, and how to notify them Format of the string is (USERNAME:[je]+),... USERNAME must be a valid name stored in the usr table. j - Sends notifications as jabbers e - Sends notifications as emails
Examples 'newellm:j,abe:e,diego:je' Sends jabber to newellm, email to abe, and both to diego.
column.name: notifyOnError

column.docs: @brief Represents all the users to notify regarding successful job completion, and how to notify them. See notifyOnError documentation for formatting details.
column.name: notifyOnComplete

column.docs: Maximum amount of time to load the job before a task is started. If a task hasn't started by the time this expires, the job will report an error and the host will be reset.
column.name: maxloadtime

column.docs: Maximum amount of memory a job is allowed to use (in bytes). If it exceeds this the task will raise an error.
column.name: maxMemory

column.docs: Not actually used for rendering, but for giving default settings to the user to change frame ranges using frameNth.
column.name: frameNth

column.docs: 0 - No Copy 1 - Copy to missing in-between frames 2 - Copy to all in-between frames 3 - Frame Fill Mode, renders in-between frames only
column.name: frameNthMode

column.docs: In kilobytes.
column.name: minMemory

column.docs: Holds the record of the wrangler actively looking at this job.
column.name: fkeyWrangler

column.docs: A health check on the job. Defines how much times can pass without output to stdout / stderr before the burner raises an error.
column.name: maxquiettime

column.docs: Contains a bit set of flags toggled on the job.
column.name: toggleFlags

column.docs: For fixed packet size jobs this option will allow the manager to reduce the packet size in order to utilize idle hosts.
column.name: allowSmallerPackets

column.docs: launch the render using 'n' threads
column.name: threads

column.docs: launch the render using 'n' processes
column.name: processes

column.docs: use 'script' to start renders
column.name: jobscript

column.docs: passes 'p' as the first parameter of script
column.name: jobscriptparam

column.docs: Override the default call to "renderdl" binary.
column.name: renderdlCmd

table.docs: Represents a "canned" batch job, that can be submitted as a batch job at any time by just selecting the hosts to run it on.
table.name: JobCannedBatch

table.docs: Each packet assigned to a host will generate a JobCommandHistory. This stores the command executed, stdout, stderr, and peak memory.
table.name: JobCommandHistory

column.docs: Dependency type. 1 = hard, 2 = soft.
column.name: depType

table.docs: Contains the environment variables used or specified when submitting a job. The farm will use these environment variables to reconstruct the appropriate environment for a job.
table.name: JobEnvironment

table.docs: JobFilterMessage stores a list of regexes that are matched against the stdout/stdout of a Job. If one is matched an action is triggered based on the JobFilterType.
table.name: JobFilterMessage

table.docs: JobFilterSet stores a list of possible filters for a job. A jobType will have a default filter set that the user can override at submission time.
table.name: JobFilterSet

table.docs:
JobFilterType stores a list of possible things that can happen when a particular regex is matched in the sdtout/stderr of a job. This list includes
Error-TaskCancel Error-TaskRetry Error-JobSuspend
table.name: JobFilterType

column.docs: This corrosponds to the MaxOpenExr enum, not the actual bit depth. Values are 0 - "Integer - 8 bits per channel" 1 - "Half Float - 16 bits per channel" 2 - "Float - 32 bits per channel"
column.name: exrSaveBitDepth

table.docs: @brief A container class to be subclassed for specific versions of Maya and MentalRay for Maya.
table.name: JobMaya

table.docs: Job type for Naiad dynamic simulations.
table.name: JobNaiad

column.docs: Append an arbitrary string to the command line, useful for "--[global var] n" flags.
column.name: append

column.docs: File path to a cache file used to restart sims part way through a render.
column.name: restartCache

column.docs: Only execute these nodes (comma-seperated list)
column.name: nodes

table.docs: Table used to keep track of screenshots taken for debugging various assburner jobs.
table.name: JobScreenShot

column.docs: Host that the screenshot was taken on.
column.name: fkeyhost

table.docs: JobService is a mapping table between jobs and any @ref Service they require on hosts to run them. A job can have multiple Service dependancies to support multiple plugin licenses, difference in machine builds etc.
table.name: JobService

column.docs: Average memory used per task in kilobytes.
column.name: averageMemory

column.docs: For performance reasons we use this as a tri-state value, NULL meaning Job.prioritizeOuterTasks is False, True or False meaning Job.prioritizeOuterTasks is True.
column.name: outerTasksAssigned

column.docs: This holds the name of the task to be displayed to the user. If label is null, the task is considered to represent a frame and the number stored in the jobtask(frameNumber) field is displayed.
column.name: label

column.docs: Maximum memory used in kilobytes.
column.name: memory

column.docs: Valid values are default - Default Scanline ogl - OpenGL scanline rapid - Rapid scanline, designed for very large scenes trace - Raytrace
column.name: renderer

column.docs: This holds the datetime when the notification was delivered to this destination. If this field is null, the notification has not been delivered.
column.name: delivered

column.docs: This is a generic field, can be used to hold email address, phone number, jabber id, etc.
column.name: destination

column.docs: Specifies the user that is being notified by this destination. Can be null if a user does not apply, or does not exist.
column.name: fkeyUser

column.docs:
This is a string encoded as follows
[SECTION],...
each section consists of:
ACTION:METHOD[:DESTINATION][:USER]
Actions consist of:
default - Sets default method/destination, user is ignored, only used for routing notificationdestinations. add - Adds a new destination using method/destination/user
Section Examples:
default:email - Sets default method to email add:email:gates@microsoft.com - Adds new destination, emails to gates@microsoft.com address
column.name: actions

column.docs: Routes are processes from lowest to highest priority. The default method can be set multiple times, so the highest priority is ultimatly used.
column.name: priority

column.docs:
This determines the time offset that the notification is delivered, in reference to the deliveryTrigger(which determines to deliver based on the notification creation or occursAt) after it has been rounded according to offsetType.
Some examples:
To deliver at 8 AM the morning of the occursAt timestamp.
deliveryTrigger = 1 - Delivery time based off occursAt deliverBefore = true - Delivery happens before the trigger, rounding is down offsetType = 2 - Rounds down to the nearest day offset = '8 hours' - Adds 8 hours to the rounded down day, to get 8am.
To deliver at 8 AM monday morning before an even occurs.
deliveryTrigger = 1 deliverBefore = true offsetType = 3 - Round to nearest week offset = '8 hours'
To deliver at 5:30 pm after the event is created.
deliverTrigger = 0 deliverBefore = false offsetType = 2 offset = '-6:30:00' - Round to midnight at the end of the day, then move backwards to 5: 30pm.
column.name: offset

column.docs: How to round the trigger time before applying the offset. 0 - No round 1 - Hour 2 - Day 3 - Week
column.name: offsetType

column.docs: 1 - Deliver in relation to the notifications created time 2 - Deliver in relation to the notifications occursAt time
column.name: deliveryTrigger

column.docs:
If true then the notification will be delivered before the occursAt time, else will be delivered after either the creation time or the occursAt time, depending on the deliveryTrigger setting.
This also determines whether the rounding set by offsetType rounds up or down. If deliverBefore is true then all rounding is down, otherwise up.
column.name: deliverBefore

table.docs: Used to associate a path with an asset, so that an asset can have multiple paths associated with it.
table.name: PathTracker

column.docs: Frames Per Second
column.name: fps

column.docs: comma seperated list of process names that can't be running for AB to start up, or pick up a job.
column.name: forbiddenProcesses

column.docs: This describes if the service is and active or passive service. Active services are running and are expected to pulse.
column.name: active

column.docs: This describes if this service should only be enabled on a single host at any given time.
column.name: unique

table.docs: Defines a particular piece of software - this is to be separate per major installation (3dsMax 2009 vs. 3dsMax)
table.name: Software

column.docs: location of software once installed
column.name: installedPath

column.docs: command to execute the software once installed
column.name: executable

column.docs: tracks the current default version of the Software (currentVersion/setCurrentVersion)
column.name: fkeySoftwareVersion

column.docs: path to the installer files for this Software
column.name: installerPath

column.docs: batch commands to be used when installing this Software
column.name: installScript

column.docs: list of processes that the installer will need to kill before running to install this Software
column.name: killWarning

table.docs: Links a particular Host to a given SoftwareVersion. This is what will allow us to track what version of each software is installed on any given machine at a time
table.name: SoftwareInstallation

table.docs: Defines a grouping of software versions into a single click installation package. Whether that is the studio standard image, or a series of installers needed to generate a test build for a particular need
table.name: SoftwarePackage

column.docs: auto-set on a new instance
column.name: created

column.docs: auto-set on a new instance to the logged in user (createdBy/setCreatedBy)
column.name: fkeyusrCreatedBy

column.docs: auto-set on commit
column.name: modified

column.docs: auto-set on commit to the logged in user (modifiedBy/setModifiedBy)
column.name: fkeyusrmodifiedby

table.docs: Tracks the status of the SoftwareVersion and SoftwarePackage records
table.name: SoftwareStatus

table.docs: Defines a particular installation for a software. This includes the name (or version) of a Software, along with the particular installer file associated with the version
table.name: SoftwareVersion

column.docs: auto-set on a new instance
column.name: created

column.docs: auto-set to the logged in user (createdBy/setCreatedBy)
column.name: fkeyusrcreatedby

table.docs: UserService is used to allocate slot limitations for Arsenal. Each User / Service combo can hard limit the number of slots ( cores ) their jobs will receive.
table.name: UserService
